findings.title: Timely massUpdatePools During Pool Weight Changes
findings.description: In the `Farming` contract, the reward pools can be dynamically added via `add()` and the weights of supported pools can be adjusted via `set()`. When analyzing the pool weight update routine `set()`, we notice the need of timely invoking `massUpdatePools()` to update the reward distribution before the new pool weight becomes effective.

findings.title: Incompatibility with Deflationary/Rebasing Tokens
findings.description: The `Farming` contract's asset-transferring routines may introduce unexpected balance inconsistencies when interacting with deflationary/rebasing tokens, requiring additional measures to ensure accurate book-keeping.

findings.title: Potential Reentrancy Risk in Farming::deposit()
findings.description: The `Farming::deposit()` function has a potential reentrancy risk due to non-adherence of the `checks-effects-interactions` principle, which can lead to malicious contract re-entrancy attacks.

findings.title: 3.4 Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the Surfswap protocol and T-Fi protocol, there are privileged administrative accounts (feeToSetter and DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) that play a critical role in governing and regulating system-wide operations.
